AttributeList.Text: phase_example This some general description in a comment table. This is a new line in the description. This is another comment table without borders. This is a new line in the 2nd table

NetworkSource.StatementList: // empty
L DINO T phase_id

AttributeList.Text: Make the Phase ID based on its DB number

NetworkSource.StatementList:
CALL em_read EM_ID := EM_I_OUT_ID UDT_LOCATION := #EM_I_OUT UDT_OFFSET := 40 Length := 40 EM_addressing_error := Addressing_Error RETVAL := MW 0
CALL em_read EM_ID := Some_Dyn_EM_ID UDT_LOCATION := #Some_Dyn_EM UDT_OFFSET := 40 Length := 40 EM_addressing_error := Addressing_Error RETVAL := MW 0

// Load the command from the HMI in AR1 LAR1 P##hmi_commands //Command from WinCC
// copy all commands to the bools
A DIX [AR1,P#3.0] // WinCC tag bit 0 = hmi_start
A DIX [AR1,P#3.1] // WinCC tag bit 1 = hmi_stop
A DIX [AR1,P#3.2] // WinCC tag bit 2 = hmi_hold
A DIX [AR1,P#3.3] // WinCC tag bit 3 = hmi_restart
A DIX [AR1,P#3.4] // WinCC tag bit 4 = hmi_abort
A DIX [AR1,P#3.5] // WinCC tag bit 5 = hmi_reset
A DIX [AR1,P#3.6] // WinCC tag bit 6 = hmi_pause
A DIX [AR1,P#3.7] // WinCC tag bit 7 = hmi_resume
A DIX [AR1,P#2.0] // WinCC tag bit 8 = hmi_auto
A DIX [AR1,P#2.1] // WinCC tag bit 9 = hmi_man
A DIX [AR1,P#2.2] // WinCC tag bit 10 = hmi_BTN1
A DIX [AR1,P#2.3] // WinCC tag bit 11 = hmi_BTN2
A DIX [AR1,P#2.4] // WinCC tag bit 12 = hmi_BTN3

AttributeList.Text: Get the commands from the HMI that have been received in the last cycle They come in a DWORD to save tags They need to be transferred to BOOLS for easy use Once transferred then clear the DWORD so new commands can be detected in the next cycle

Get the commands from the HMI that have been received in the last cycle They come in a DWORD to save tags They need to be transferred to BOOLS for easy use Once transferred then clear the DWORD so new commands can be detected in the next cycle

NetworkSource.StatementList:
O plc_start O hmi_start = command_start
O plc_stop O hmi_stop = command_stop
O plc_hold O hmi_hold = command_hold
O plc_restart O hmi_restart = command_restart
O plc_abort O hmi_abort = command_abort
O plc_reset O hmi_reset = command_reset
O plc_pause O hmi_pause = command_pause
O plc_resume O hmi_resume = command_resume
O plc_auto O hmi_auto = command_auto
O plc_man O hmi_man = command_man
A command_auto S auto
A command_man R auto
CLR = enable_man = enable_auto
A auto = enable_man
AN auto = enable_auto
A hmi_BTN1 = button_1_pushed
A hmi_BTN2 = button_2_pushed
A hmi_BTN3 = button_3_pushed

AttributeList.Text: Combine the commands from the HMI and PLC in one command (OR-function)

If the previous stepnumber is not the same as the current one then reset the timers, else increase them This is at the start of the FB because normal stepchanges will take till the next cycle to become active

If timers are needed that cannot be solved with the steptime. Timers need to start with the name 'timer' They are paused by default They can be unpaused They can be reset by writing the value to 0 in the action Every timer is available in s, m and h

NetworkSource.StatementList: L stepnumber L previous_stepnumber <>I = initial_scan

AttributeList.Text: create a pulse active on the first cycle of a new scan this signal can be used in the step to execute some actions in the first cycle of the step

NetworkSource.StatementList: L stepnumber T previous_stepnumber

AttributeList.Text: Change States -------------------------------- This phase template is design to let the stepnumber be the single source of truth for the state of the phase. All other indicators of state from this phase are deducted from the stepnumber. And the state can only be changed by changing the stepnumber For every state we both create a bit, and an integer value Both have the same meaning and can be chosen for usage based on what is most convenient

Update Phase States based on the stepnumber 0 idle 1 running 2 completed 3 pausing 4 paused 5 holding 6 held 7 restarting 8 stopping 9 stopped 10 aborting 11 aborted ------------------------------- See previous network for explanation

NetworkSource.StatementList: CLR O XV003_MERR O XV004_MERR O XV005_MERR O P001_MERR O P001_MPS O P002_MERR O P002_MPS O EM_I_OUT.CM_error O LT001_ERR O LT002_ERR O FIC001_ERR O Some_Dyn_EM.CM_error O XV008_MERR = Module_Error

AttributeList.Text: Collect the errors from the connected Modules (CMs and EMs)

NetworkSource.StatementList:
CLR
// clear the error no L 0 T CM_Error_no T EM_Error_no
A XV003_MERR JCN E1
L 57 // 'CM error: XV003_MERR' T CM_Error_no
E1: NOP 0
A XV004_MERR JCN E2
L 58 // 'CM error: XV004_MERR' T CM_Error_no
E2: NOP 0
A XV005_MERR JCN E3
L 59 // 'CM error: XV005_MERR' T CM_Error_no
E3: NOP 0
A P001_MERR JCN E4
L 60 // 'CM error: P001_MERR' T CM_Error_no
E4: NOP 0
A P001_MPS JCN E5
L 61 // 'CM error: P001_MPS' T CM_Error_no
E5: NOP 0
A P002_MERR JCN E6
L 62 // 'CM error: P002_MERR' T CM_Error_no
E6: NOP 0
A P002_MPS JCN E7
L 63 // 'CM error: P002_MPS' T CM_Error_no
E7: NOP 0
A EM_I_OUT.CM_error JCN E8
L EM_I_OUT.CM_error_no T CM_Error_no
L 64 // 'EM error: EM_I_OUT_ERR' T EM_Error_no
E8: NOP 0
A LT001_ERR JCN E9
L 65 // 'CM error: LT001_ERR' T CM_Error_no
E9: NOP 0
A LT002_ERR JCN E10
L 66 // 'CM error: LT002_ERR' T CM_Error_no
E10: NOP 0
A FIC001_ERR JCN E11
L 67 // 'CM error: FIC001_ERR' T CM_Error_no
E11: NOP 0
A Some_Dyn_EM.CM_error JCN E12
L Some_Dyn_EM.CM_error_no T CM_Error_no
L 68 // 'EM error: Some_Dyn_EM_ERR' T EM_Error_no
E12: NOP 0
A XV008_MERR JCN E13
L 69 // 'CM error: XV008_MERR' T CM_Error_no
E13: NOP 0

AttributeList.Text: This code tries to assign an error message to each CM error If multiple CMs have an error then it only stores one This is the phase type so we don't know which CM/EM instance is connected So the error only contains the general name of the CM/EM instance If the actual name needs to be shown then it could be deducted at a higher level using the CM/EM name and phase instance
Assign a message number to each error

NetworkSource.StatementList: SET = start_conditions = hold_conditions // true = safe condition
// empty placeholder network

AttributeList.Text: START OF THE STEPS AND TRANSITIONS
Test step with only a comment and transition
Test multiple comments this is another line
Test some spacing before the comment Test some spacing before the first comment word
test a simple assignment with a variable
test a simple assignment with a REAL
test a simple assignment with some BOOLS
test with some spaces and non-matching casing => should still work
test first and last scan actions
test if primary suffixes are detected
test primary suffixes in action side
test multiple conditions without explicit logic
test first line without logic and rest with AND
test first line without logic and rest with OR
test button with capital => no problem, the button is case insensitive
test button without opening quotation marks => no problem, any marks are just removed
test button without closing quotation marks => no problem, any marks are just removed
test 4 buttons => not foreseen in the template, so should log an error
test falseword with two words in transition
test trueword with multiple words in action
test putting controller in auto with pulseword
test putting controller in auto with pulseword consisting of multiple words
test steptime with unit separated by space => still works (because it takes the last character)
test steptime with variable with unit
test timer with variable with unit
test putting a controller in manual
test putting a controller in manual while changing the output value
test putting a controller in manual while changing the output value that has a unit
test direct access to a CM instance in dot-format in the assignment => should convert to suffix
test direct access to a CM in dot-notation in the evaluation => should convert to suffix
test dot-format to Linked CM in assignment => should convert to suffix
test dot-format from Linked CM in evaluation =>should convert to suffix
test direct access to an EM instance in dot-format in the assignment => should stay in dot-format
test direct access to a EM in dot-notation in the evaluation => should stay in dot-format
test dot-format to Linked EM in assignment => should stay in dot-format
test dot-format from Linked EM in evaluation =>should stay in dot-format
test suffix-format to Linked EM in assignment => should convert to dot-format
test suffix-format from Linked EM in evaluation =>should convert to dot-format
test absolute value calculation to int value
test absolut function of another calc
test multiple transitions in one step
assignment where the right part is a boolean variable
comparison where the right part is a boolen variable

NetworkSource.StatementList: // jump location for the step that is currently active ENDS: NOP 0

AttributeList.Text: END OF THE STEPS AND TRANSITIONS

NetworkSource.StatementList:
CALL em_write EM_ID := EM_I_OUT_ID UDT_LOCATION := #EM_I_OUT UDT_OFFSET := 40 Length := 40 Request :=EM_I_OUT.Request Owner :=EM_I_OUT.Owner EM_addressing_error := Addressing_Error RETVAL := MW 0
CALL em_write EM_ID := Some_Dyn_EM_ID UDT_LOCATION := #Some_Dyn_EM UDT_OFFSET := 40 Length := 40 Request :=Some_Dyn_EM.Request Owner :=Some_Dyn_EM.Owner EM_addressing_error := Addressing_Error RETVAL := MW 0
// empty placeholder network
